Machine Learning Cheat Sheet

Authors: Vincent Granville

This document serves as a beginner's guide to machine learning, providing a foundational cheat sheet for those starting from scratch. It emphasizes the importance of a local development environment, specifically recommending a Windows laptop with a Linux layer installed via Cygwin. The author advocates for using Cygwin to leverage the familiarity of Windows applications alongside the flexibility of Linux. The core of the guide focuses on setting up a suitable hardware environment ‚Äì a modern Windows laptop ‚Äì as the primary device for data science projects. It highlights the need for regular backups using services like Dropbox. The document suggests utilizing FileZilla for file transfers and connects the need for a local environment to external services like AWS or remote servers. The author stresses the importance of having a Windows laptop as the central hub for accessing both Windows applications and Linux tools, making it a versatile platform for data science exploration. The guide implicitly encourages a hands-on approach, suggesting that users should start with a local setup before moving to cloud-based solutions. It‚Äôs a practical guide aimed at newcomers to the field, prioritizing a readily accessible and familiar development environment.
